results.title: At the Movies, Bagels, Onions and a Side Dish of Nothing
results.abstract: Both “Everything Everywhere All at Once” and the “Knives Out” sequel delve into the abyss, where life has no meaning. What they do next is surprising.
des_facet: Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Michelle Yeoh, left, and Stephanie Hsu in one of the alternate universes of “Everything Everywhere All at Once.”
Michelle Yeoh, left, and Stephanie Hsu in one of the alternate universes of “Everything Everywhere All at Once.”
Michelle Yeoh, left, and Stephanie Hsu in one of the alternate universes of “Everything Everywhere All at Once.”

results.title: For the Documentarian Alice Diop, Only Fiction Could Do Justice to a Tragedy
results.abstract: “Saint Omer” borrows details from a case of infanticide in France, which the director found raised profound but very personal issues.

multimedia.caption: “There is no doubt that the process of going through this film is something that healed me,” Alice Diop, the director of “Saint Omer,” said.
multimedia.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.title: Filming Eugene O’Neill When the Elements (and Investors) Don’t Cooperate
results.abstract: Starring Jessica Lange and Ed Harris, Jonathan Kent’s adaptation of “Long Day’s Journey Into Night” started production, only to lose key financing.

multimedia.caption: Jonathan Kent, right, is making his feature directing debut with the drama.
Jonathan Kent, right, is making his feature directing debut with the drama.
Jonathan Kent, right, is making his feature directing debut with the drama.

results.title: Older Moviegoers Turn Out for ‘A Man Called Otto’
results.abstract: Ticket sales totaled $15 million over the holiday weekend, fueled by older audiences in the middle of the country.

multimedia.caption: Crowds showed up for “A Man Called Otto” in cities like Detroit, Minneapolis, Denver and Salt Lake City. None of the top 75 theaters for the film were in Los Angeles or New York.
Crowds showed up for “A Man Called Otto” in cities like Detroit, Minneapolis, Denver and Salt Lake City. None of the top 75 theaters for the film were in Los Angeles or New York.
Crowds showed up for “A Man Called Otto” in cities like Detroit, Minneapolis, Denver and Salt Lake City. None of the top 75 theaters for the film were in Los Angeles or New York.

results.title: Bill Nighy, Master of Misdirection
results.abstract: Though his turn in the drama “Living” is the subject of Oscar chatter, just try getting him to talk about his art. He prefers self-deprecation instead.

multimedia.caption: Kazuo Ishiguro wrote the part of Mr. Williams in “Living” specifically for Nighy: “To play that English person and add to it something profoundly, hauntingly human that isn’t just English, but universal — that’s something quite special,” the writer said.
multimedia.copyright: Ariel Fisher for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Kazuo Ishiguro wrote the part of Mr. Williams in “Living” specifically for Nighy: “To play that English person and add to it something profoundly, hauntingly human that isn’t just English, but universal — that’s something quite special,” the writer said.

results.abstract: Li Xiaofeng’s film turns a crime soap opera into an allegory about China’s head-spinning modernization.

results.title: ‘Virtually Heroes’ Review: Game Over, Man
results.abstract: After a decade on the shelf, this action comedy is streaming for the first time. But while the action is dated, the comedy is antique.

multimedia.caption: Robert Baker, left, in “Virtually Heroes,” an action comedy about a video game character who becomes bored of his heroic obligations. Mark Hamill, right, has a brief cameo.

results.title: Critics Choice Awards 2023: The Complete Winners List
results.abstract: “Everything Everywhere All at Once” wins the top prize, while Brendan Fraser takes best actor for “The Whale” and Cate Blanchett triumphs for “Tár.”

results.title: Gina Lollobrigida, Movie Star and Sex Symbol, Is Dead at 95
results.abstract: She began her career in her native Italy, and although she achieved fame in America, she worked more often in Europe. She later had a second career as an artist and filmmaker.

multimedia.caption: Gina Lollobrigida in the 1953 Italian-French comedy “Fanfan la Tulipe.” A year after it was released in the United States, she was on the cover of Time magazine.
Gina Lollobrigida in the 1953 Italian-French comedy “Fanfan la Tulipe.” A year after it was released in the United States, she was on the cover of Time magazine.
Gina Lollobrigida in the 1953 Italian-French comedy “Fanfan la Tulipe.” A year after it was released in the United States, she was on the cover of Time magazine.

results.title: India’s Love Story With a Movie Still on the Big Screen After 27 Years
results.abstract: ‘D.D.L.J.,’ which a Mumbai theater has shown nearly every day since 1995, encapsulates a society in churn, with the choices afforded by economic opportunity clashing with tradition.
results.byline: By Mujib Mashal, Suhasini Raj and Atul Loke

multimedia.caption: A woman who goes by the name Simran has become a regular at screenings of “Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge” at the Maratha Mandir cinema in Mumbai.
A woman who goes by the name Simran has become a regular at screenings of “Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge” at the Maratha Mandir cinema in Mumbai.
A woman who goes by the name Simran has become a regular at screenings of “Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge” at the Maratha Mandir cinema in Mumbai.

results.title: A Doll That Wears Sunglasses With Attitude? Oh, ‘M3gan’ Is a Gay Movie.
results.abstract: The title robot — reminiscent of the loyal but messy straight women that gay men are protective of — is progress for a genre with a shameful history.

multimedia.caption: The killer doll in “M3gan” is fashionable, knowing and cutting.
The killer doll in “M3gan” is fashionable, knowing and cutting.
The killer doll in “M3gan” is fashionable, knowing and cutting.

results.title: Prosecutors to Announce Whether They Plan Charges in ‘Rust’ Case
results.abstract: More than a year after the fatal shooting, Santa Fe County prosecutors said they would announce on Thursday whether anyone would be charged in the case.

multimedia.caption: The district attorney for Santa Fe County, N.M., wrote last year that up to four people could be charged in connection with the fatal shooting on the “Rust” movie set.

results.title: What Will Be Nominated for Oscars on Tuesday? What Won’t Be?
results.abstract: It’s an unusually wide open year for the Academy Awards. But our expert has a good idea about what will make the cut. Here are his projections.

results.title: A Rosier View of Roald Dahl
results.abstract: “Teller of the Unexpected,” an elegant new biography, sidesteps the ugly side of the children’s book author while capturing his grandiose, tragedy-specked life.

results.title: Edie Landau, Film Producer Ahead of Her Time, Dies at 95
results.abstract: She and her husband invented a model for faithfully adapting acclaimed literature, illuminating an alternate path for independent cinema.

results.title: Kevin Spacey Pleads Not Guilty to 7 Charges of Sexual Misconduct in U.K.
results.abstract: The Oscar-winning actor had already pleaded not guilty in July to five other counts of sexual misconduct. He is currently out on bail.

results.title: For a Deadly Doll, a Killer Wardrobe
results.abstract: The titular star of the horror film “M3gan,” released last week, had to try on several outfits before finding a signature look.

results.abstract: ‘Avatar: The Way of Water,” “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever” and “Top Gun: Maverick” made the cut. “The Woman King” and “Women Talking” were snubbed.
